summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an individual to appear before the grand jury on September 24, 2020, to testify and produce documents in an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), 371 (conspiracy), and 1623 (false statements).
The recipient is commanded to appear before a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York on September 24, 2020, at 10:00 a.m.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena includes an 'Advice of Rights' informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
